intro: Pouchetia africana var. africana, commonly known as the African pouchetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
